alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 9:21AM MDT until April 21 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... Elm River at Westport affecting Brown County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elm River at Westport. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, The bridge northwest of Kruse Dam will be overtopped At 16.0 feet, Several gravel roads along the river begin to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 16.1 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning to 11.7 feet early Sunday morning. It will rise to 12.0 feet Monday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening by 630 PM CDT.
